column4: hello all. I installed ubuntu 8.04 lts server on a laptop and it refuses to boot. Says that I got the wrong processor. How can I force it to boot or change the kernel?
the kernel?
I tried both
and I could install the 32 bit system all the way
and it won't reboot
comp+laining about the processor
Starting up: This kernel requires the following features not present on the CPU: 0:6 Unable to boot, please use a kernel appropriate for your CPU
PAE?
what's that?
is that withi vbox you get that message
on boot
on boot within virtual box or a native system
what cpu do you have ?
ahhh your tyring to install teh server
the server kernel is for enterprise hardware, not for the laptop
your cpu does not have the requirments for the server kernel
what is wrong with the desktop version ?
thank you so much for your valuable help
is tehre a problem with you using the desktop
